alert.note: Alert for Howell; Texas (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 17 at 8:08PM CST until December 18 at 2:15AM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Howell County in south central Missouri... Southeastern Texas County in south central Missouri... * Until 215 AM CST Saturday. * At 808 PM CST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mountain View, Willow Springs, Clear Springs and Peace Valley. This includes the following low water crossings... Gill Branch at Highway Y, South Prong Jacks Fork River at Highway U, Eleven Point River at County Road 1550, South Fork Jacks Fork River at Stillhouse Road and Elevin Point River at Highway U. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
